content: perception socks shelbi hrkach perception is a simple cuff-down pattern with colourwork sections on the leg and foot and a german short-row heel a broken corrugated rib adds a little extra interest to the cuff without overpowering the main pattern so grab a cup of something lovely get comfortable and allow yourself to get lost in your knitting for a little while 1 sizes small large with foot circumferences 8 inches 9 inches or 20 cm 23 cm with adjustable length gauge 32 stitches and 40 row for a 4-inch 10 cm square materials needles us 1 2 25mm knitting needles or size needed to get gauge yarn ❖ 2 skeins of woolly mammoth fibre co natural sock 50% bfl 50% cheviot wool 400m/100g 1 skein burnt terracotta 1 skein cloud or ❖ 2 skeins of contrasting colours of yarn 60 g of main colour 30 g of contrast colour notions stitch markers tapestry needle abbreviations bobble bind off p purl bor beginning of round pm place marker cc contrast colour s - slip co cast on sm slip marker ds double stitch ssk slip slip knit k knit st stitch k2tog knit two together sts - stitches mc main colour 2 instructions cuff the cuff is worked in a sort of modified corrugated ribbing as this can be a bit tighter than you may prefer any simple ribbed cuff would be a fine substitute with cc co 64 72 sts using german twisted co or your preferred stretchy cast on place bor marker and join to work in the round being careful not to twist sts round 1 *k1 p1* repeat *-* to end of round join mc and work round 2 round 2 sm *k1 cc k1 mc* repeat *-* to end of round round 3 sm with cc *k1 p1* repeat *-* to end of round repeat rounds 2 & 3 another 7 times 8 total repeats break cc row 2 make ds p 31 35 tw row 3 make ds k until last ds tw leg row 4 make ds p until last ds tw k 15 rounds or approximately 1 inch 2 54 repeat row 3 & 4 another 10 11 times cm you ll want to make note of how many there should be 11 13 sts between ds rounds you knit as this will be repeated after sections with 10 12 ds on the left and 9 11 the leg colourwork chart to balance the leg ds on the right join cc and begin working leg colourwork row 5 make ds k until next ds kdsx2 tw chart 47 rounds found on the second to last page break cc row 6 make ds out of the ds you just knitted p until next ds pdsx2 tw k 15 rounds or the same number of rounds you knit before the leg colourwork chart row 7 make ds out of ds you just purled k until next ds kdsx2 tw repeat row 6 & 7
